Module com.alike
Package com.alike.graphsystem

Class NodeContainer

java.lang.Object
com.alike.graphsystem.NodeContainer
public class NodeContainer extends Object
Used to manage sets of nodes for use in StaticGraph objects.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor

    Constructs a new NodeContainer from a Coordinate array.

  • Constructor Details

    • NodeContainer

      public NodeContainer()
      Used to initialise a new empty NodeContainer object.

    • NodeContainer

      public NodeContainer(ArrayList<Node> nodeSet) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Used to initialise a new filled NodeContainer.
      Parameters:
      nodeSet - The set of nodes that will populate the container.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if two nodes occupy the same coordinates in the input node set.

    • NodeContainer

      public NodeContainer(Collection<Coordinate> cL) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Constructs a new NodeContainer from a Coordinate array.
      Parameters:
      cL - An array of coordinates.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown when an attempt is made to superimpose nodes.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(Node n) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Used to add a new node to container.
      Parameters:
      n - The new node to add.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if the new node's coordinates are already occupied by a node already in this container.

    • remove

      public void remove(Node n)
      Used to remove a node from this container.
      Parameters:
      n - The node to remove.

    • checkNodeSetForSuperimposition

      public void checkNodeSetForSuperimposition(ArrayList<Node> nSet) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Used to check an input node set for nodes occupying the same coordinates.
      Parameters:
      nSet - The node set to check.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if nodes where found to occupy the same coordinates.

    • setNodeSet

      public void setNodeSet(ArrayList<Node> nodeSet) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Sets the node set to a new value.
      Parameters:
      nodeSet - The new value to become the node set.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if the new node set contains nodes occupying the same coordinates.

    • getNodeSet

      public ArrayList<Node> getNodeSet()
      Returns the value of the @code{nodeSet} attribute.
      Returns:
      nodeSet The value of the nodeSet attribute of this NodeContainer object.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Used to represent this NodeContainer object as a JSON format string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String This container as a JSON format string.

    • getNodeIDs

      public ArrayList<Integer> getNodeIDs()
      Returns an array containing all the node IDs of the nodes in the set of this container.
      Returns:
      int[] An array containing all the node IDs of the nodes in the set of this container.

    • getNodeByID

      public Node getNodeByID(int id) throws NonExistentNodeException
      Returns a node object given its unique identified (ID). Knowing that the set is always ordered, we can just retrieve by index.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID attribute of the node you wish to get.
      Returns:
      Node The node with matching ID to input.
      Throws:
      NonExistentNodeException - Thrown if the node was not found.

    • getNodeByIdSearch

      public Node getNodeByIdSearch(int id) throws NonExistentNodeException
      Returns a node object given its ID, if this container is not ordered (should never be the case).
      Parameters:
      id - The ID to find.
      Returns:
      n The node found with a matching ID.
      Throws:
      NonExistentNodeException - Thrown if no node was found with a matching ID.

    • getNodesWithVisitedState

      public ArrayList<Node> getNodesWithVisitedState(boolean getVisitedOrUnvisited)
      Returns an array list containing all the nodes that have an equal boolean as their @code{visited} attribute.
      Parameters:
      getVisitedOrUnvisited - The value of visited you would like the nodes of.
      Returns:
      ouput The array list containing the nodes that had a matching value of visited.

    • getNodeCoordinates

      public ArrayList<Coordinate> getNodeCoordinates()
      Returns the coordinates of all the nodes in the node container.
      Returns:
      cL An array list containing the coordinates of all the nodes in the container.

    • trimToSize

      public void trimToSize()
      Used to call the underlying array lists trimeToSize() method.

    • toStorageFormat

      public String toStorageFormat(char delimiter)
      Outputs the nodes in the container as a string that can be stored and later read back into program memory.
      Parameters:
      delimiter - The separating element between node coordinates.
      Returns:
      string The node container represented as a string.

    • createFromStorageString

      public static NodeContainer createFromStorageString(String storedContainer) throws NodeSuperimpositionException
      Creates a node container given a string of coordinates in storage format.
      Parameters:
      storedContainer - The coordinates from storage as a string.
      Returns:
      container The newly initialised and filled @code{NodeContainer} object.
      Throws:
      NodeSuperimpositionException - Thrown if the incoming string has duplicate coordinates causing the method to try to create nodes on the same coordinate.
